Package seng202.team4.controller

Class MapTabController

  • java.lang.Object
    • seng202.team4.controller.MapTabController
  • public class MapTabController
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs the logic for the 'Map' tab of the application. Responsible for filtering and displaying route and airport data using the Google Maps API with the JavaFX WebView. Filtering is done through searchable comboboxes, where the selected filters are passed through to the map.html HTML/Javascript script to be executed - here, the airport or routes are shown on the map. Radio button selection is used to switch between route and airport filtering.

        public MapTabController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialises map by calling init(). Abstracted as init has to be called by other methods too.

      • initialiseRefreshButtons

        private void initialiseRefreshButtons()
        Initialise refresh buttons by setting their images and tooltips.

      • init

        private void init()
        Executes set of instructions for initialising the map tab. Initialises the map, then the radio buttons, then finally the comboboxes.

      • initMap

        private void initMap()
        Initialises the Google Map by creating a new WebEngine for the JavaFX WebView then loading the map.html resource onto the WebEngine.

      • initialiseRadioButtons

        private void initialiseRadioButtons()
        Adds a listener to the radio toggle group such that switching between radio buttons means switching between different filters shown. Uses the displayRouteFilters() and displayAirportAirlineFilters() methods.

      • initialiseComboBoxes

        private void initialiseComboBoxes()
        Populates filtering comboboxes by querying the SQL database. Uses initialiseRouteComboBoxes() to initialises the route grid comboboxes. Catches exceptions caused by SQL errors.

      • initialiseAirportComboBoxes

        private void initialiseAirportComboBoxes()
        Specifically initialises/populates the route filtering comboboxes by querying the SQL database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if there is an error querying the SQL database

      • initialiseRouteComboBoxes

        private void initialiseRouteComboBoxes()
        Specifically initialises/populates the route filtering comboboxes by querying the SQL database.

      • displayRouteFilters

        private void displayRouteFilters()
        Toggles on displaying of the route filer grid. Toggles off the displaying of the airport filter grid.

      • displayAirportAirlineFilters

        private void displayAirportAirlineFilters()
        Toggles off displaying of the route filer grid. Toggles on the displaying of the airport filter grid.

      • showSelectedRoutes

        private void showSelectedRoutes()
        Clears map and then shows the routes selected from the Routes tab by querying the RoutesSelected table. Catches any error/exception caused by SQL querying. Each route is shown separately using showOneRoute(). Activated when 'Show Selected Routes' button is clicked in the GUI.

      • routeApplyFilter

        private void routeApplyFilter()
        Clears map then, using values in the comboboxes, shows filtered results of routes in the map. Routes must be less than ROUTELIMIT. All SQL Exceptions are handled here. Activated when the 'Apply Button' in the route filters grid is clicked.

      • showOneRoute

        private void showOneRoute​(java.sql.ResultSet routesResultSet,
                          java.sql.Connection connection)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Shows one route on the Google Map by querying the Airport table for coordinates then using the WebEngine to execute a javascript script from map.html.
        Parameters:
        routesResultSet - JDBC ResultSet of all routes that need to be shown (only top one is shown here).
        connection - The database connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - When there is an error when interacting with the SQL database using JDBC.

      • showSelectedAirports

        public void showSelectedAirports()
        Clears map and then shows the airports selected from the Airports tab by querying the AirportsSelected table. Catches any error/exception caused by SQL querying. Each airport is shown separately using showOneAirport(). Activated when 'Show Selected Airports' button is click in the GUI.

      • showAirportsOnMap

        private void showAirportsOnMap​(java.sql.ResultSet airportResultSet)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Given a ResultSet of Airports from SQL, show all these airports on the Google Maps using showOneAirport() for each.
        Parameters:
        airportResultSet - ResultSet of airports to show
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown when there is an error with resultset.next() method

      • showOneAirport

        private void showOneAirport​(java.sql.ResultSet airportResultSet)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Shows one airport on the Google Map by using the given ResultSet for coordinates then using the WebEngine to execute a javascript script from map.html.
        Parameters:
        airportResultSet - JDBC ResultSet of all routes that need to be shown (only top Airport is shown here).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - When there is an error when interacting with the SQL database using JDBC.

      • airportApplyFilter

        private void airportApplyFilter()
        Clears map then, using values in the comboboxes, shows filtered results of airports in the map. All SQL Exceptions are handled here. Activated when the 'Apply Button' in the airport filters grid is clicked.

      • getValidInput

        private java.lang.String getValidInput​(java.lang.String inputString)
        Gets valid inputs for the SQL queries in routeApplyFilter() and airportApplyFilter(). If inputString == null this means that no value is entered in the combobox(es) so it means 'all' of that type are chosen, so in SQL this means 'is not null' for getting every value.
        Parameters:
        inputString - Value obtained from the respective combobox.
        Returns:
        Either a String "not null" or "'inputString'"

      • clearMap

        private void clearMap()
        Uses clearMap() method in map.html javascript to remove all points/routes on the Google Map. Activated when the 'Clear Map' button is clicked in the GUI (and is used by other methods in this class).

      • clusterMarkers

        public void clusterMarkers()
        Make airport markers cluster in Google Maps

      • repositionMap

        private void repositionMap​(java.lang.String filter)
        Reposition map according to either routes or airports
        Parameters:
        filter - either 'Routes' or 'Airports' to determine which markers to reposition on

      • executeScript

        public void executeScript​(java.lang.String scriptToExecute)
        Connects the Java String for a JavaScript method execution to the map.html script. Converts Java to JavaScript and uses the WebEngine to execute the script.
        Parameters:
        scriptToExecute - Javascript script to execute.
